summary: Email correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York forwarding a copy of an indictment against two correctional officers at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) for failures in their duties related to the night of Jeffrey Epstein's suicide. The document is now public.

persons.name: Stephen E. Boyd
persons.context: Addressee of the email forwarding the indictment; appears to be a recipient from OLA (likely Office of Legislative Affairs).

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Co-Chief, Public Corruption Unit, U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Copied on the email; identified as Co-Chief of the Public Corruption Unit in the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the individual who died by suicide at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), which led to the indictment of two correctional officers.

connections.description: Strauss's office is communicating with Boyd, likely in an official capacity regarding the indictment.

events.title: Indictment of MCC Correctional Officers
events.description: An indictment was obtained charging two correctional officers at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) for failures to perform their duties on the night of Jeffrey Epstein's suicide.

events.title: Suicide of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: Two correctional officers at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) were indicted for failures in their duties related to the night of Jeffrey Epstein's suicide.
The indictment was obtained and filed with the court on November 19, 2019, making it a public document.
The email correspondence involves the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, specifically the Public Corruption Unit co-headed by Audrey Strauss.
Jeffrey Epstein's death is referenced as a suicide that occurred while he was in custody at MCC.
